title: Microsoft Authenticator on iOS moves backups fully to iCloud
summary: Microsoft is rolling out a new backup system in September for its Authenticator app on iOS, removing the requirement to use a Microsoft personal account to back up TOTP secrets and account names. [...]

title: Microsoft confirms Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) sync is broken
summary: Microsoft has confirmed a widespread issue in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) that prevents organizations from syncing with Microsoft Update and deploying the latest Windows updates. [...]

title: Qantas confirms data breach impacts 5.7 million customers
summary: Australian airline Qantas has confirmed that 5.7 million people have been impacted by a recent data breach, in which threat actors stole customers' data. [...]

title: Google reveals details on Android’s Advanced Protection for Chrome
summary: Google is sharing more information on how Chrome operates when Android mobile users enable Advanced Protection, highlighting strong security improvements. [...]

title: Bitcoin Depot breach exposes data of nearly 27,000 crypto users
summary: Bitcoin Depot, an operator of Bitcoin ATMs, is notifying customers of a data breach incident that has exposed their sensitive information. [...]

title: Gold Melody IAB Exploits Exposed ASP.NET Machine Keys for Unauthorized Access to Targets
summary:
The Initial Access Broker (IAB) known as Gold Melody has been attributed to a campaign that exploits leaked ASP.NET machine keys to obtain unauthorized access to organizations and peddle that access to other threat actors.
The activity is being tracked by Palo Alto Networks Unit 42 under the moniker

title: Ruckus Networks leaves severe flaws unpatched in management devices
summary: Multiple vulnerabilities that remain unpatched in Ruckus Wireless management products could be exploited to fully compromise the network environment they serve. [...]

title: Ingram Micro starts restoring systems after ransomware attack
summary: Ingram Micro has begun restoring systems and business services after suffering a massive SafePay ransomware attack right before the July 4th holiday. [...]

title: Treasury sanctions North Korean over IT worker malware scheme
summary: The U.S. Department of the Treasury sanctioned cyber actor Song Kum Hyok for his association with North Korea's hacking group Andariel and for facilitating IT worker schemes that generated revenue for the Pyongyang regime. [...]

title: The MFA You Trust Is Lying to You – and Here's How Attackers Exploit It
summary: MFA Authenticator apps aren't cutting it anymore. Attackers are bypassing legacy MFA with fake sites and real-time phishing. Token Ring and BioStick stop them cold—with fingerprint-bound hardware. Learn more from Token. [...]

title: DoNot APT Expands Operations, Targets European Foreign Ministries with LoptikMod Malware
summary:
A threat actor with suspected ties to India has been observed targeting a European foreign affairs ministry with malware capable of harvesting sensitive data from compromised hosts.
The activity has been attributed by Trellix Advanced Research Center to an advanced persistent threat (APT) group call

title: New ServiceNow flaw lets attackers enumerate restricted data
summary: A new vulnerability in ServiceNow, dubbed Count(er) Strike, allows low-privileged users to extract sensitive data from tables to which they should not have access. [...]
